title: Evidence Mounting That Avio Intends to Split from Arianespace
summary: Avio CEO Giulio Ranzo told Wired that work being done on a reusable demonstrator may be a prelude to an entirely new product line for the company.

title: INTERVIEW: We Sit Down With RFA COO Stefan Brieschenk
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) is a new name in the spaceflight industry that you've probably heard a lot over the past few years. If you haven't, we've got you covered! Back in March, TLP was given the opportunity to have an interview with RFA's Chief Operating Officer and Co-Founder, Dr. Steffan Brieschenk, who talked to us about RFA's Background, engines, facilities, future and more.

title: With 7,000+ satellites and growing, is space sustainable? An Ars Frontiers recap
summary: "We've been using space as our own personal operating dumping ground."

title: Rivada seeks Ex-Im financing for satellite constellation
summary: Rivada Space Networks is hoping to secure support from the U.S. Ex-Im Bank to finance a multibillion-dollar satellite constellation whose future also depends on an impending decision by international regulators.

title: Nearly two decades after NASA, China and Europe eye commercial cargo plans
summary: Doing so, however, will be challenging.

title: Blue Origin within a “few weeks” of resuming New Shepard flights
summary: Blue Origin expects to be ready to resume launches of its New Shepard suborbital vehicle in the next few weeks as it completes its recovery from an in-flight anomaly nine months ago.

title: NASA Psyche mission back on track for October launch
summary: An independent review has concluded NASA’s Psyche asteroid mission is back on track for a launch this October after software problems, exacerbated by institutional issues at JPL, delayed its launch last year.

title: Game on—the most metal of asteroid missions is back on the menu
summary: "We believe Psyche is on a positive course for an October 2023 launch."

title: Review Board: NASA-JPL Psyche Progress Outstanding, Launch on Track
summary: Steps taken by NASA, the agency’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) in Southern California, and Caltech, to put the Psyche mission on track for an October 2023 launch have been outstanding, according to an independently appointed review board. title: EOS Data Analytics and Space Electric Thruster Systems demonstrate technology in orbit
summary: EOSDA, Dragonfly and Space Electric Thruster Systems (SETS) are part of the Noosphere Group, established in 2014 by international entrepreneur Max Polyakov to create an integrated space business.
